content: wave and box twist cowl the wave and box twist cowl is knit sideways in a tube to give a super soft and squishy finish that will keep you cosy on chilly autumn days it is a quick knit that is perfect for tv or travel knitting and the pattern allows for some really fun colour experimentation skills and techniques used materials provisional cast on yarn kitchener stitch drops daisy dk in cobalt blue mc and off white cc 100% wool 110m/50g - 2 balls of mc and 1 or cast on & bind off see notes on page ball of cc 2 needles knit 2 x 4 5mm/us 7 - 16-inch/40cm circular needle or slipping stitches needles for chosen method of working in the round working in the round on circular needles horizontal mattress stitch notions 1 stitch marker size darning needle 23 4 wide by 8 tall when lay flat before seaming 10 wide by 8 tall when seamed - the twist takes away some of the width gauge you can make the cowl shorter or longer by adding or subtracting a pattern 20 sts/30 rounds = 4 inches square in slipped stitch repeat one full pattern repeat will add pattern using 4 5mm needles after blocking 2 1 all measurements are in inches © aimee lee 2024 1 abbreviations and notes cc - contrast colour k - knit mc - main colour no - number sts - stitches sl wyib - slip stitches purl wise with yarn in back notes the pattern repeats are 10 stitches long and repeat 8 times across the round charts have been created for a dark main colour/light contrast colour and a light main colour/dark contrast colour for ease of use you can follow the charts or the written instructions in the table the cowl is designed to be seamless by using a provisional cast on and a kitchener stitch bind off if you would prefer you can cast on using a regular long tail cast on and bind off using a flexible bind off before sewing both ends together using horizontal mattress stitch tutorials provisional cast on and picking up provisional stitches https //blog tincanknits com/ 2015/07/16/provisional-cast-on-needle-and-hook-method/ kitchener stitch https //blog tincanknits com/2013/10/03/kitchener-stitch/ horizontal mattress stitch https //www youtube com/watch v=rghxqqqzbms © aimee lee 2024 2 instructions using 4 5mm needles and some waste yarn provisionally cast on 80 stitches using the cc knit 1 row flat start working from the table or charts on pages 6 and 7 on round 3 joining the cowl in the round at the end placing a marker at the end to mark the end/beginning of the round work the instructions in the table below or charts on pages 6 and 7 11 times total round instructions no of repeats no complete 1 using mc -
